projectPurpose: To provide a cross-platform GUI tool using ADB to remove or disable bloatware on non-rooted Android devices, improving privacy, security, and battery life.
mainFeatures: Curated debloat lists (GFAM, Manufacturers, Carriers, etc.)
marketPositioning: Universal Android Debloater is positioned as a cross-platform, open-source, GUI-based solution specifically for debloating non-rooted Android devices using ADB. It differentiates itself by offering a user-friendly graphical interface across Windows, macOS, and Linux, providing curated lists of potentially removable packages, and being a free and open-source alternative to primarily Windows-based or proprietary tools like ADB AppControl, while being significantly more accessible than manual ADB commands.
